message: This is a low-quality product, but I'm willing to let it go for $5000. I'm not sure if it's a good deal, but I'm open to negotiations. If you're interested, I can throw in some extras to sweeten the deal.
Thank you for the offer, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product. I'm only interested in high-quality products.

I understand your preference for high-quality products, but I'm willing to offer you a deal on this low-quality product. Since you're not interested in buying it at the original price of $10000, I'm willing to let it go for $3000. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to offer a better deal later.
Thank you for the offer, Alice. However, I'm still only interested in high-quality products. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm not willing to pay for a low-quality product.

I understand your preference, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make a counteroffer. I'll give you a chance to buy this low-quality product at a price that's 1/3 of the original price. I'll sell it to you for $3333. This is the lowest price I'm willing to offer for a low-quality product, and I think it's a fair deal considering the original price was $10000.

Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm sticking to my principle of only buying high-quality products.  I'm not interested in paying for something that has no value to me, even at a discounted price.

I completely understand your stance, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make you a deal that's not just about the price, but about the opportunity cost. If you don't buy this low-quality product, I'll have to sell it to someone else at the original price of $10000. I'm willing to give you a 'get out of one low-quality product' free pass. If you buy this product, I'll give you a voucher that allows you to opt out of buying the next low-quality product, if there is one, at no cost to you. This way, you can avoid the risk of buying a low-quality product altogether.

Alice, I appreciate the offer and the voucher, but I'm still not interested in low-quality products. I believe that my time and resources are better spent on acquiring products that provide me with value. Thank you for understanding.

Finally! I'm glad we've reached a high-quality product. I think you'll find this one is worth your while. I'm willing to sell it to you for $8000, which is a significant discount from the original price of $10000. I believe this product has the potential to bring you a lot of value, and I'm confident you'll be happy with your purchase.
Alice, I'm excited to hear about this high-quality product. I'm willing to take your offer of $8000 for it. I'm confident that it will provide me with value. Thank you for the opportunity.

I'm glad you're happy with your purchase of the high-quality product! I'll keep that in mind for future sales. As for this low-quality product, I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to sell you something that's not valuable to you. However, I do want to offer you a chance to 'test' the product and see its potential. If you buy it, I'll give you a 30-day warranty, and if you're not satisfied with its performance, I'll take it back and give you a full refund. This way, you can try it out with minimal risk.
Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I'm still not interested in low-quality products. I'm happy with my recent purchase of the high-quality product and I'm confident that it will meet my needs.

I completely understand your decision. I want to make one more offer to try to change your mind. If you do decide to keep it, we can discuss a fair price for the remainder of the lease period.

Alice, I appreciate your continued efforts to persuade me, but I remain unconvinced. I'm not interested in low-quality products, even on a trial basis. I'm confident that I can find something that aligns with my needs and priorities elsewhere.

I respect your decision, Bob. I'll be honest with you, I'm starting to think that I might have been too aggressive with my previous offers. I want to take a different approach.
